This looks good overall.  Just a couple of comments.

---

Reviewed 25 of 25 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks failed.

---

*[src/core/tsi/transport_security.h, line 58 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15313#-LC4rQL2Apki5tOi4Cg7:-LC4rQL2Apki5tOi4Cg8:b-d5o58h) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/68db94e975b664b5c7b067b35cd362a698e0a7b6/src/core/tsi/transport_security.h#L58)):*
> ```objc
>    See transport_security_interface.h for documentation. */
> typedef struct {
>   tsi_result (*get_bytes_to_send_to_peer)(tsi_handshaker* self,
> ```

Any reason not to remove these deprecated methods in this PR?

---

*[src/core/tsi/transport_security.h, line 98 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15313#-LC4qbYT1PHaF24kyrFF:-LC4qbYT1PHaF24kyrFG:b-jn0297) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/aef957950aa3390e3516531ca2d783de8fc9333b/src/core/tsi/transport_security.h#L98)):*
> ```objc
>       size_t* max_output_protected_frame_size,
>       tsi_zero_copy_grpc_protector** protector);
>   tsi_result (*create_frame_protector)(const tsi_handshaker_result* self,
> ```

It seems odd to make this a non-const method when the other methods are all const.  Possible alternatives, in order of decreasing preference:

- Keep this as const and don't bother resetting the fields in the result object.  Instead, just document that the caller must only create the frame protector once from a given result object.

- Keep this as const and use a const_cast<> to reset the fields in the result object.  This is a bit ugly, but it is consistent with the idea that this doesn't actually modify the result object from the caller's perspective.

- Change all of these methods to be non-const.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15313#-:-LC4sxkk0WmvUhbvrgbZ:bicqb5l)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[src/core/tsi/transport_security.h, line 58 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15313#-LC4rQL2Apki5tOi4Cg7:-LC4uW0K0YNFleJv5JWk:bvomziq) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/68db94e975b664b5c7b067b35cd362a698e0a7b6/src/core/tsi/transport_security.h#L58)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
Any reason not to remove these deprecated methods in this PR?
GFE is still calling TSI using old API. We cannot get rid of the old deprecated methods yet. --- *[src/core/tsi/transport_security.h, line 98 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15313#-LC4qbYT1PHaF24kyrFF:-LC4v8MN5XMhTxk70YcO:b6a0hpb) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/aef957950aa3390e3516531ca2d783de8fc9333b/src/core/tsi/transport_security.h#L98)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
It seems odd to make this a non-const method when the other methods are all const. Possible alternatives, in order of decreasing preference: - Keep this as const and don't bother resetting the fields in the result object. Instead, just document that the caller must only create the frame protector once from a given result object. - Keep this as const and use a const_cast<> to reset the fields in the result object. This is a bit ugly, but it is consistent with the idea that this doesn't actually modify the result object from the caller's perspective. - Change all of these methods to be non-const.
In fact, I tried (1) before creating this PR. It will crash due to following: during create ssl frame protector, ssl and network_io pointers are copied to frame protector. Say we do not reset nullptr of these value in handshaker_result. during destroy of handshaker result, it will destroy ssl and network_io. when frame protector tries to use it, it will crash. It is safer to set ssl and network_io to nullptr after frame protector is created. Let me do (2) then --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15313)*
